content:
Ruth Lewis said
I described this problem on this forum a couple of hours ago--but I now know any response to help me will come via email How can I get some help not sent via email.

This is a community support forum as there is no direct support done by email, chat, ticket nor phone.

Any emails you get will be automated emails informing you of replies to threads you have started or posted in here.

Replies can take anywhere from minutes to hours or longer. btw to reply in a thread that is not locked, scroll down to the Post a Reply box, type in your reply, then click on Post Reply.
creator: James

content:
it may help to know the explicit details of what you did.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

creator: peterburman20

content: The folder to copy from old computer is named 'thunderbird' and must be done when thunderbird is not running. There will already be a thunderbird folder on new computer, since thunderbird is to already be installed and not running. On new computer the exported thunderbird folder is to be pasted over the existing thunderbird folder
creator: davidsk
